actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Veterans.

official_title: A bill to amend chapter 19 of title 38, United Stated Code, to permit the unrestricted assignment of a beneficiary's interest in the proceeds of a Government Life Insurance policy in cases involving contested claims, and to increase the amount an attorney may receive for representing a claimant in such cases, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Veterans Insurance Amendments Act of 1981 - Permits the unrestricted assignment of a beneficiary's interest in the proceeds of a National Service Life Insurance policy in cases involving contested claims. Limits the amount assignable to an attorney representing a claimant.

titles.title: A bill to amend chapter 19 of title 38, United Stated Code, to permit the unrestricted assignment of a beneficiary's interest in the proceeds of a Government Life Insurance policy in cases involving contested claims, and to increase the amount an attorney may receive for representing a claimant in such cases, and for other purposes.
